result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • David Allen Westrich Jr was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: David Allen Westrich Jr
parties.address: 493 E. Perkins St., Apt. 7, Medford, WI 54451

parties.name: Taylor County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: The defendant may receive huber and good time.
If probation is revoked, a 15 month driver's license revocation period shall take effect.  Credit given for any administrative suspension.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA  and comply with with any recommendations.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall submit a DNA sample.  Defendant shall undergo an AODA and follow through with all recommendations.  Defendant shall attend the next OWI victim impact panel on July 7, 2016.  Defendant shall successfully complete the OWI treatment court.  Defendant shall obtain his HSED/GED or adult diploma through the Medford Adult Diploma Program.    Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

timeConds.notes:
The jail sentence shall begin no later than July 13, 2016 at 4:30 pm.  Good time granted.  The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  
Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.

records.addlTxt: DOC Face Sheet Intake and Investigation

Defendant David Allen Westrich in court with attorney Shawn M Paul.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Plea of no contest to Count 2 - OWI 2nd offense.  Plea colloquy.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.   Court finds defendant guilty of count 2.  Count 3 is dismissed outright and 15TR992.  Counts 1 and  4 are dismissed and read in.   Case No. 15TR993 - defendant enters a plea of no contest.  Court finds defendant guilty and orders forfeiture of $200.50.  The forfeiture is due August 13, 2016.  On Count 2 - OWI - 2nd court orders an imposed and stayed sentence of $1,855.00 fine; 85 days county jail jail and 15 month revocation of driver's license probation for 2 years with conditions of participate in Taylor County OWI Treatment Court; $1,429.00 fine inclusive of costs; 5 days county jail with huber and good time, county jail to begin no later than July 13, 2016 at 4:30 pm; 12 month revocation of driver's license; AODA; IID for one year; blood draw fee of $45.00; DNA sample; OWI victim impact panel scheduled for July 7, 2016; obtain his HSED or GED or adult diploma through the Medford Adult Diploma Program.  - rt
Preliminary hearing on June 13, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 10, 2016 at 09:45 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 20, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Statements
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the court. Defendant shall comply with booking procedures at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department. Attorney Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  David A. Westrich, Jr. appeared in person, in custody.  David Westrich wrote a letter to the court requesting that his bond be reduced. Statement by defendant.  Statement by Attorney Tlusty.  Notice of right to an attorney given to defendant.  Court modifies bond to a $2,000.00 signature bond with the same conditions as previously ordered.  - rt

Initial Appearance on February 9, 2016 at 1:00 p.m.
Arrest Report

ADR began at 10:05 am.  Attorney Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  David A. Westrich, Jr. appeared in person, in custody.  Court finds probable cause for arrest without warrant based on the arrest header.  Attorney Tlusty requests a $250.00 cash bond and a $1,000.00 signature bond; booking; no possession or consumption of alcohol; no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Court sets bond as requested by Attorney Tlusty.  Next court date is an initial appearance scheduled for February 9, 2016 at 1:00 pm.  ADR ended at 10:10 am - rt
